questions.text: The episode opens outside of the Anneville Hotel. Who or what was the first character shown?
questions.explanation:
The Prairie Dog mascot.

	The local high school is called the Prairie Dogs. The first character to walk into the frame was the mascot, shown next was a bum sleeping next to the hotel and then there was a large chase scene. Turned out the chase scene was a paintball fight where a man named Clive was chasing down a pair of young ladies. When he shot Lacy with the paintball, she stepped back, fell into an underground sewer and died.

questions.text: In the flashback scene, young Jesse was caught smoking by his father. What was his punishment?
options: He wasn't allowed to attend church that day.
He lost the privilege of playing video games.
He wasn't allowed to date for 6 months.
questions.explanation:
He was whipped in public.

	In the flashback Jesse was shown to be a child, between 8- and 10-years-old. His father, John, was the preacher at the time and publicly whipped Jesse. Also during the flashback Jesse was shown to be helping out at the church, putting out hymn books and otherwise helping get ready for a morning service.

questions.text: What did Jesse want to give away as an incentive to get more people to the church?
questions.explanation:
A flat screen TV.

	Jesse went to visit Emily to discuss how to get more people to the church. They had only had 25 people in the church the week before. The TV cost about $1,000 to purchase. She was worried the church couldn't afford it for a temporary rise in attendance.

questions.text: The Anneville mayor appears in this episode for the first time in the series. Who played the mayor?
questions.explanation:
Ricky Mabe.

	The mayor was known as Miles Person. His first appearance was to discuss the problem of sinkholes appearing all over town.  Mabe made his acting debut in 1996 in the movie "Frankenstein and Me".

questions.text: Which regular character went to the Toadvine Whorehouse to sample the wares?
questions.explanation:
Cassidy.

	Cassidy, the vampire, met with DeBlanc and Fiore at the local motel, and then went on to the whorehouse instead of going to find Jesse like they expected him to. While at Toadvine, he got high and hired a hooker.

questions.text: The mayor was also Emily's babysitter.
questions.explanation:
True.

	She had to get a sitter in order to go buy the TV for the church. He refused to let her pay him, agreed to have a drink with him, but pointed out to that she had no romantic interest in him. She did however sleep with him, as long as he left before morning so the kids didn't see him.

questions.text: Tulip attempted to kill Clive after he was not sorry about the death of Lacy. Instead she attacked which other person?
questions.explanation:
Cassidy.

	Tulip ran up to a room where one of the girls was with who she thought was Clive, attacked Cassidy and shoved him out a window. He fell, and had glass lodge in his neck. On the way to rush him to the hospital she finds out that he is a vampire when he recovered from the injury.

questions.text: Who did Jesse try to convert in front of the church?
questions.explanation:
Odin.

	Odin was a well known atheist. He used the TV giveaway to grow the size of the parish, and then converted him using the powers he had discovered at the start of the season. He picked Odin out from among the others in the town because John Custer had been turned away from Odin's office when Jesse was a child.

questions.text: Jesse and Odin Quincannon worked on a project together the Saturday night before church. They built a scale model of the first manned spacecraft.
questions.explanation:
False.

	While they did work together on building a model, the project was a scale representation of the Alamo during the famous battle there. Odin was painting the soldiers, and Jesse was placing them on the map where they needed to go. It was during this conversation that Jesse convinced Odin to come to church were he was able to convert the man back to religion.

questions.text: What type of device did Fiore and DeBlanc have that they claimed communicated with heaven?
questions.explanation:
An old phone.

	Twice the phone played a key role in the episode. Once they were going to call and seek help, before deciding against it because they didn't have permission to be on Earth. Then later in the episode, just before the end, it started to ring. They didn't answer it before the episode faded to black.
